title: Prince Harry 'badly advised' in decision to take on the press
text:
The Duke of Sussex has been ‘badly advised’ over his decision to sue the owners of The Mirror and The Sun over phone hacking, fear friends of the royal family.

Their concerns came after Prince Harry escalated his 'war against the tabloid media' by filing papers at the High Court over the illegal interception of voicemail messages dating back to the 2000s.

There are fears among those close to the palace that the Prince’s move will put him at the centre of an unnecessary row over the freedom of the press.

Penny Junor, Prince Charles's biographer and author of numerous books on the Royal family, said: "Prince Harry is just not thinking clearly and he doesn't seem to have anybody sensible advising...
